description: Kennesaw State is offering a new way to buy your tickets: a three-game “mini plan” that includes what will be the first football game at SunTrust Park.
title: Kennesaw State selling 3-game packages, including SunTrust Park match
title_page: Kennesaw State selling 3-game packages, including SunTrust Park match
text:
Kennesaw State is offering a new way to buy your tickets: a three-game “mini plan” that includes what will be the first football game at SunTrust Park.
The university announced the new package Thursday, prices ranging from $50 to $65, that includes the following games:
• Sept. 29 vs. Samford (6 p.m.)
• Nov. 3 vs. Campbell (2 p.m.)
• Nov. 17 vs. Jacksonville State (at SunTrust Park)
KSU is now also selling single-game tickets for the season-opener against Georgia State, which will be played at the old Turner Field, now Georgia State Stadium.
READ | Kennesaw State will now play football on ‘carpet-based hybrid grass’
READ | Hit after hit, is historic Concord Road Covered Bridge worth keeping?
Apparently the Owls want to play anywhere the Braves have played; there’s no word if they’ll have a game at the Fulton County Stadium.
The GSU game at the former Turner Field will be 7 p.m. on Aug. 30. Tickets are $25.
You can buy tickets online here or over the phone at 470-578-4849.
